result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb S C Streich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall have no contact with NKB and JLD.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb S C Streich

records.addlTxt: Letter received from various relatives of defendant

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb Streich in custody and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Resolution reached with defense free to argue.  Defense renews Motion to Exclude, Seal and Disregard Nonparty Letters.  Argument by counsel.  Court denies defense motion.  Court will give defense opportunity to rebut any information in these submissions.  Defendant wishes to proceed to plea and sentencing.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Recess to allow Court to review Document #6 (materials discussed earlier in this hearing) and also the unsigned statement from defendant's family submitted today by the State.  Reconvene.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
CORRECTED NOTICE:  Hearing on August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb Streich in custody and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Court addresses Defense Motion to Exclude, Seal and Disregard Nonparty Letters.  Argument by counsel.  Court finds the motion is premature prior to sentencing and further denies at this time.  Defense motions to modify bond.  State opposes.  Court denies any modification of bond.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in court in custody and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Court informs counsel that Document #6 in the Court's file has not been reviewed per request of Atty. Beltran.  Counsel's first appearance.  Defense requests a special time to address motion to exclude, seal and disregard nonparty letters.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Motion hearing on August 4, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion to Exclude, Seal and Disregard Nonparty Letters
No dangerous weapons; No contact with NKB or JLD

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Timothy Drewa.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.  $150 cash bond set.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
